channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Walmart Is on a Winning Streak
item.description: It is now the S&P 500’s best-performing retail stock in 2024, and with good reason.

item.title: DraftKings reverses plans for a tax on customers as FanDuel parent Flutter wows Wall Street
item.description: Earlier this month, DraftKings said it would introduce a surcharge on users in states where taxes on sports betting are highest. FanDuel wouldn't follow suit.

item.title: Investors Still Face Fog of Uncertainty on Economy, Fed
item.description: Markets remain vulnerable to swings in monetary policy expectations.

item.title: Alibaba earnings miss expectations despite cloud acceleration
item.description: Alibaba continues to face headwinds in its core e-commerce business amid rising competition and a cautious Chinese consumer.

item.title: Warren Buffett's Berkshire Hathaway Takes Ulta Beauty Stake, Sending Shares Up
item.description: The legendary investor added to positions in Chubb and Occidental Petroleum.

item.title: Walmart beats estimates, raises outlook as it sees stable consumer health
item.description: Walmart beat quarterly earnings and revenue estimates and hiked its full-year guidance.

item.title: Mars Megadeal Shows Big Food Wants to Get Bigger
item.description: Mars’s nearly $30 billion deal to buy Pringles maker Kellanova would push the candy company into the chips and cracker aisles and hand it more of the growing global snacks business.

item.title: UBS smashes second quarter profit expectations as Credit Suisse consolidation boosts revenue
item.description: Analysts expected revenue of $11.5 billion, according to an LSEG poll.

item.title: S&P 500 Climbs With Traders Weighing Size of Rate Cut
item.description: Walmart earnings and retail sales on Thursday will offer more clues on the economy.

item.title: World's largest sovereign wealth fund posts $138 billion in first-half profit as AI demand boosts tech
item.description: Norway's massive sovereign wealth fund on Wednesday posted first-half profit of 1.48 trillion kroner ($138 billion).
